sentences.en: By a cruel irony, his horse came down on a flat part of the course.
sentences.cn: 十分残酷而且极具讽刺意味的是，他的马在赛场的平地上摔倒了。

sentences.en: Caine has always been an actor who excels in irony.
sentences.cn: 凯恩向来是个擅长讽刺的演员。

sentences.en: Do I detect a note of irony in your voice?
sentences.cn: 听起来你是在说反话 吧 ?

sentences.en: He was an adapt in the irony of incongruously grouping.
sentences.cn: 他精通于冷嘲各种不协调的人物.

sentences.en: Her coarse irony was as painful as her anguish.
sentences.cn: 她那粗俗的讽刺口气和她的痛苦心情,令人感到难受.

sentences.en: His face shadowed with deep lines of bitter irony.
sentences.cn: 他脸上的深深的皱纹显示出一种辛酸、讥嘲的神气.

sentences.en: His tone was tinged with irony.
I will show you how gracefully I can lay irony aside.
sentences.cn: 我以后会让你看到我会怎样落落大方地将讽刺弃置不用.

sentences.en: In her voice we could sense a certain tinge of irony.
sentences.cn: 从她的声音里我们可以感到某种讥讽的意味.

sentences.en: Life is full of little ironies.
sentences.cn: 生活中充满了小小的讽刺。

sentences.en: One could break away into irony -- as indeed he often had to.
sentences.cn: 自我解嘲一下就完了 -- 事实上他时常就是这样.

sentences.en: She broke from the inconsequent meaningless mild tone of irony.
sentences.cn: 她中断了她无关痛痒,无足轻重的温和的嘲讽语调.

sentences.en: She said to him with slight irony.
The corners of her mouth suggested the least trace of irony.
sentences.cn: 她的嘴角上浮现一丝儿讽刺的痕迹.

sentences.en: The phrase is loaded with irony.
There is a delicious irony in all this.
sentences.cn: 这一切中包含了一种绝妙的讽刺。

sentences.en: They find only irony in the narrator's concern.
sentences.cn: 他们发现叙述者只是一味地嘲讽。

words.tran_cn: 讽刺；反语；具有讽刺意味的事

trans.tran_cn: 反语，讽刺，冷嘲，具有讽刺意味的事，[语]反语法
trans.tran_en: a situation that is unusual or amusing because something strange happens, or the opposite of what is expected happens or is true
